page.title: 09Industry.
page.content: The Tynemouth Incinerator began working in 1971.It receives all the rubbish from the North Tyneside area and 50% of Newcastle's waste. The raw rubbish is brought to the Incinerator by the dustbin lorries where it is burnt down by 90% to a kind of ash. This ash is then taken to a landfill area where it is covered under land reclaimation. The Incinerator handles 500 tonnes of raw rubbish daily and because of regular upkep it now produces more than the day it opened.It will stay working for another 10 years when it will be either be replaced by a re-cycling plant ,or a waste disposal plant which could easily be adapted to produce electricity. by Sonia Pringle
